revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Corporate law|by country}}
'''French company law''' is the law governing corporations incorporated in [[France]] or under French corporate law.
==History== In the wake of the [[French Revolution]] in 1791, the right to free registration for all private companies was proclaimed. There was a boom in registrations, but this was followed by a bust in 1793. The law was reversed until 1796 when the principle of free incorporation was established again.
The law was consolidated in Napoleon's ''[[Code de commerce]]'' of 1807 using a concession system. While previously public companies with special privileges were created by a special act of the state, the ''Code'' allowed the companies to be formed according to general company law rules. Specific state permission was still required. Article 33 recognised [[limited liability]] for members.<ref>Art. 33 Code de Commerce, adopted by Law No. 2804, November 1807, Bull. des Lois No. 164 (1808), 161–299 (France).</ref> The ''Code de commerce'' was applicable outside France in [[Baden]] and the [[Prussian Rhine]] province, and it came to serve as a model for all later European public company statutes. The first German public company statute was the Prussian Act of 1843, five years after the Prussian Act on railway enterprises of 1838. Under the ''[[Loi sur les Sociétés]]'' of 1867 France adopted a system for free registration of companies.<ref>See Law of July 24, 1867 amending the Code de Commerce, Bull. des Lois 11e S., B. 1513, n. 15, 328 p. 94</ref>
==See also== *[[UK company law]] *[[European company law]] *[[German company law]] *[[US corporate law]] *[[List of company registers]]
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:French Company Law}} [[Category:French business law]]

The '''Guangzhou Peugeot Automobile Company''' (GPAC) is a former automobile manufacturer located in [[Guangzhou]], [[China]]. It was a [[joint venture]] between the Guangzhou municipal government and the [[Peugeot]] brand of the [[France|French]] automobile manufacturer [[PSA Peugeot Citroën]].{{citation | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=IFWY9J9QwLsC&lpg=PA78&dq=Guangzhou%20Automobile%20Group&pg=PA78#v=onepage&q&f=false | title = China CEO: a case guide for business leaders in China | page = 78 | first1 = Juan Antonio | last1 = Fernandez | last2 = Liu | first2 = Shengjun | publisher = John Wiley and Sons | year = 2007 | location = Singapore | isbn = 978-0-470-82224-1}} The company was founded on 26 September 1985 and was defunct by March 1997 when Peugeot sold their stake in the joint venture.{{citation | title = PSA Peugeot Citroën in China (Press Kit) | url = http://www.peugeot-presse.de/download/zahlendatenfakten/PM_PSA_in_China_en_2004_06.pdf | page = 4 |date=June 2004 | publisher = PSA Peugeot Citroën }} [[Citroën]], a sister brand in [[PSA Peugeot Citroën]], already had a successful joint venture which began production in 1992, ([[Dongfeng Peugeot-Citroën Automobile|Dongfeng-Citroën]]). In 2002, the Peugeot brand was reintroduced to China through Dongfeng. ''World of Cars 2006·2007'', p. 230 After the company had gone defunct, [[Honda]] joined with the Guangzhou government to establish its own joint venture company, [[Guangqi Honda Automobile]]. ==History== [[File:Peugeot 504 truck (2).jpg|thumb|right|A locally developed [[crew cab]] version of the Peugeot 504 pickup]] One of the first foreign-Chinese joint auto-making ventures,[https://books.google.com/books?id=IFWY9J9QwLsC&lpg=PA91&dq=Guangzhou%20Automobile%20Group&pg=PA91#v=onepage&q&f=false Fernandez and Liu, p. 91] over its eleven-year lifespan the company only recorded production of about 100,000 cars.[https://books.google.com/books?id=IFWY9J9QwLsC&lpg=PA86&dq=Guangzhou%20Automobile%20Group&pg=PA86#v=onepage&q&f=false Fernandez and Liu, p. 86] Manufacturing two models originally sold via fleet sales, its products were mostly used as [[Taxicab|taxi]]s or by government employees.[https://books.google.com/books?id=IFWY9J9QwLsC&lpg=PA79&dq=Guangzhou%20Automobile%20Group&pg=PA79#v=onepage&q&f=false Fernandez and Liu, p. 79] Fleet sales commenced in 1989, with a model line comprising the [[Peugeot 505]] (1980 design) and [[Peugeot 504|504]] (1968 design). ===Conflict=== Component localization targets, set to encourage creation of a local [[supply chain]], exacerbated tensions. They were met late if at all, and while the French initially profited from parts sales, Chinese consumers saw increased component localization from inexperienced suppliers lead to inferior products.[https://books.google.com/books?id=IFWY9J9QwLsC&lpg=PA80&dq=Guangzhou%20Automobile%20Group&pg=PA83#v=onepage&q&f=false Fernandez and Liu, p. 83] In spite of Chinese resistance, Peugeot repatriated profits,[https://books.google.com/books?id=IFWY9J9QwLsC&lpg=PA81&dq=Guangzhou%20Automobile%20Group&pg=PA81#v=onepage&q&f=false Fernandez and Liu, p. 81] and cultural conflicts continued throughout. By 1993, a soured Peugeot saw its now-inferior models out-completed by better offerings[https://books.google.com/books?id=IFWY9J9QwLsC&lpg=PA85&dq=Guangzhou%20Automobile%20Group&pg=PA85#v=onepage&q&f=false Fernandez and Liu, p. 85] with sales dropping to 2,544 while competing [[Shanghai VW]] built no less than 146,000 cars—fifty percent of the overall market. By 1996, the Guangzhou government decided it no longer wanted a French foreign partner. Peugeot removed itself in 1997,{{citation | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=Oej72nssLcUC&lpg=PA137&dq=%22Guangzhou%20Automobile%22&pg=PA137#v=onepage&q&f=false | title = Changing lanes in China: foreign direct investment, local government, and auto sector development | page = 137 | first = Eric | last = Thun | publisher = Cambridge University Press | date = March 2008 | isbn = 9780521724098 }} and Guangzhou Automotive chose to begin a new joint venture with Honda.{{cite book | title = World of Cars 2006·2007 | publisher = Media Connection Sp. z o.o. | location = Warsaw, Poland | page = 234 | year = 2006 }} ==Ownership== PSA Peugeot Citroën held 22% ownership, with a total foreign ownership of 26% to 30%. ==Model gallery== Image:Peugeot 504 truck (2).jpg|1989-1997
[[Peugeot 504|广州标致GP7200卡车]]
Guangzhou-Peugeot GP 7200 Truck Image:Peugeot 505 02 China 2016-04-11.jpg|1990-1997
[[Peugeot 505|广州标致GP7202/7203]]
Guangzhou-Peugeot GP 7202/7203 ==References== {{reflist}} {{GAC Group}} {{Automotive industry in the People's Republic of China}} {{PSA Peugeot Citroën}} [[Category:Motor vehicle manufacturers of China]] [[Category:Peugeot factories]] [[Category:Motor vehicle assembly plants in China]] [[Category:GAC Group joint ventures]] [[Category:Joint ventures]] [[Category:Vehicle manufacturing companies established in 1979]] [[Category:Manufacturing companies based in Guangzhou]] [[Category:Peugeot]] [[Category:PSA Group]]

revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=January 2009}}
'''Harry Henry''' (11 March 1916 – 22 November 2008) was born in London on 11 March 1916, as the elder son of an accountant, who died in 1924. His mother brought up and provided for her two sons by working as a dressmaker. Henry was one of Britain's [[market research]] pioneers whose contributions to its acceptance and understanding won him an international reputation. He was the last survivor of the 23 founders of the Market Research Society (MRS), which he helped establish in 1947, and which now has 8,000 members in 50 countries. He married Mary Anstey, daughter of [[Vera Anstey]], in 1938. She died in 1989, a year after they had celebrated their golden wedding anniversary.
In publishing, he was Marketing Director of the Thomson Organisation for nine years, where he also became a Deputy Managing Director. His influence was significant in pulling an old-fashioned conservative industry towards the appreciation and practice of marketing in newspapers and magazines, a benefit inherited by radio and television. He was the first to use the computer in a market research study. In 1988, he received the Market Research Society's rarely awarded Gold Medal. In 2004, he received the [[Advertising Association]]'s prestigious Mackintosh Medal, awarded for outstanding personal and public service to the industry (in this case, only the third time in the previous fifteen years, and also in recognition of forty years as chairman of its Advertising Statistics Committee).
==Education== He attended two primary schools, one in Finchley and the other in Hackney and at the age of eleven was transferred to Upton House London County Council Central School, in Homerton. This type of school, an early experiment in state secondary education, had just been created for students up to the age of sixteen, who would otherwise be leaving school at fourteen, to extend their general education with the addition of some commercial subjects. He obtained the London Matriculation with Honours, and was awarded a Wedgewood Scholarship to City of London College in 1932. In 1934, he was awarded a [[Bursary]] that enabled him to enter the [[London School of Economics]] (LSE), where he read Economics, with Statistics as a subsidiary subject.
In those days, the LSE had less than 3,000 students. Henry served as Senior Treasurer of the Students' Union, Editor of the [[Clare Market Review]], the Union's official magazine (after having edited and largely written Felix, an extremely unofficial one), Chairman of the Social Committee, Chairman of the Literary Society, Business Manager of the Review of Economic Studies (an academic journal), and Vice-Chairman of the Labour Society.
Towards the end of this, he was involved in a libel action arising from an article he wrote in the [[University of London]] [[University of London Union|Union]] Magazine, pointing out that the [[gerrymandering]] involved in the election of the M.P. for London University gave control to the commercial correspondence colleges, whose interests were commercial rather than academic. Pressure from the judge ([[in chambers]]) led to a reluctant withdrawal, but there were no damages and he was convinced that Higher Authority had organised a cover-up.
He obtained a [[B.S.|B.Sc.]] (Economics) in 1937, which qualified him for his first job. Colman Prentis & Varley, a relatively new and extremely small advertising agency, having gained two minor advertising accounts from [[Procter & Gamble]] (just beginning to make a presence felt in the UK, under the name of Thomas Hedley) learnt that it would need a market research department. They went to LSE to find somebody to fill this role, in the mistaken belief that what was required was a [[statistician]]. Henry was appointed to this post in 1938, and began to learn about market research, largely by experiment. He supplemented this as the London correspondent of the [[Boston Globe]], providing a weekly column on the various social and other activities of the family of [[Joseph Kennedy]], the then US [[ambassador]] to London.
==War== The outbreak of war terminated these apprenticeships, and he was called up in 1940. After training in the ranks of the [[Royal Artillery]], he was commissioned in 1941, and served as a regimental officer in various anti-aircraft batteries until 1943, when he transferred to the newly formed statistical branch of the Army as a [[Staff Officer]]. He was eventually posted to the Headquarters staff of Montgomery's [[21st Army Group]], where he played a modest part in the preparations for the invasion of Europe and in subsequent operations in France, Belgium and Germany.
During the latter part of this period, he found the opportunity to use his market research skills in surveys of radio listening among the troops in that theatre of war, and was also responsible for the introduction of a number of what would later be referred to as Information Systems. One of these involved the production of a weekly abstract of administrative statistics for circulation throughout the theatre, and another, the devising and operating of 'TOCCI' (Theatre Officers Central Card Index), a system making use of [[Hollerith]] punched-card equipment to facilitate and speed up the [[demobilisation]] of officers.
==Post war== Henry was demobilised with the rank of Major in 1946. He returned to Colman Prentis & Varley, which had begun to move into the big league, first as Market Research Manager and shortly thereafter as Director and General Manager of Market Information Services Ltd, a subsidiary company that he created from scratch. By the time he left Market Information Services in 1954, it had grown into one of the top ten research companies in the country. These years were a period of rapid expansion in the field of market research as a whole, and he took his part in the development of many of the procedures which subsequently came into common use.{{Citation needed|date=November 2010}}
===Market Research Society=== He was one of the 23 people who, in 1946, founded the Market Research Society, and played a major role both in the development of research techniques and in the promotion of market research as a tool of [[management]]. His particular interest in the media of communication was stimulated by the fact that he was responsible for the planning, conduct and production from 1947 to 1953 of the Hulton Readership Surveys, which were the predecessors of what became the National Readership Surveys. In this same area, he was responsible for the Hulton Tables of Advertisement Attention Value (1949), the development of the first system for using punched-card equipment to compute net press coverage (1949), and the first national surveys of readership among farmers (1947), among retailers (1948) and among children (1950). He was also Editor and joint author of The Rural Market (1948) and Patterns of British Life (1950).
===McCann-Erickson Advertising=== In 1954, he joined [[McCann-Erickson]] Advertising Ltd. as Director of Research, and there built up a very sizeable research department, more closely integrated with the overall workings of the agency than was usual in those days. In particular, it became agency policy to persuade clients (particularly new clients) that full-scale research into their markets would result in more effective advertising. In 1959, he launched Marplan Ltd., a subsidiary company, which developed along these lines into what was one of the leading market research agencies in Great Britain. He organised the establishment of sister Marplan companies in Belgium, France and Germany, and was Chairman of the McCann-Erickson European Research Committee, while continuing as a senior member of the board of McCann-Erickson Ltd.
===Revolution in research=== During the mid-1950s, he had come to the conclusion that the existing techniques of market research, though adequate to the measurement of consumer behaviour, could not offer a reliable framework for marketing decisions. This led to the publication of his 1958 book, ''Motivation Research: Its Practice and Uses'', the first on the subject to be published in Europe. In this book, he drew on his experience to produce a practical guide to the rigorous scientific use of indirect techniques to produce insights which, he argued, could not be validly or even reliably derived from direct questioning or discussion.
===The Thomson Organisation=== In 1961, he was invited to join the Board of [[Thomson Organization|The Thomson Organisation Ltd]], then principally (apart from its ownership of Scottish Television) the publisher of the [[The Sunday Times (UK)|Sunday Times]] and a raft of regional newspapers, as Director of Marketing, bringing marketing into newspaper publishing for the first time.
In 1962, he established the annual Thomson Medals and Awards for Advertising Research, which, by stimulating fresh thinking on media research problems, were responsible over the following ten years for the formulation and dissemination of a number of fundamental contributions to the theory and practice of advertising. Also in 1962, he took advantage of the relaxation by [[Nikita Khrushchev]] of the rigidity of Soviet rule to mount an unprecedented promotion exercise for the recently launched Sunday Times Colour Magazine, which did not immediately return satisfactory advertising revenue. This involved hiring a Tupulev 114 from [[Aeroflot]] in which to fly a plane-load of British business tycoons for the week-end, to meet and talk to their opposite numbers in Moscow.
In 1965, after successfully tendering for the contract from Post Office Telecommunications for the introduction into the UK of '[[yellow pages]]' telephone directories, he set up and was the first Chairman of Thomson Yellow Pages Ltd. In 1968, he and Mick Shields (of [[Associated Newspapers]]) were asked by Cecil King, then Chairman of the Newspaper Publishers' Association, to examine the practicability of the introduction into the Association of a marketing function as a means of improving the efficiency of the national newspaper industry and of enabling it better to withstand competition. This led to the establishment of a consortium, the 'NPA Marketing Executive' (which he chaired) and the recruitment of some specialist staff, but which petered out because, as he observed then and at intervals over the next thirty years, the national newspaper publishers would always prefer to hang separately than to hang together. But what might be regarded as its successor was launched in 2002 as the Newspaper Marketing Agency. He left the Thomson Organisation in 1970, setting up his own consultancy in 1971.
===Admap=== As Consultant Editor and subsequently as Editor-in-Chief of Admap, he consolidated that publication's reputation for intellectual stringency and authority, which sets it aside from the generality of newsy, even gossipy, advertising periodicals. In 1983, he joined Mike Waterson in setting up a modest venture to launch the quarterly Food & Drink Forecast. This developed rapidly, and had grown by 1998 into Information Sciences Ltd and become one of the world's largest private sector suppliers of economic information through its operating arm NTC Research Ltd, and one of the world's major publisher of advertising and media knowledge via Admap, many other trade journals and books, and the [http://www.warc.com World Advertising Research Center].
==Impact on the field of marketing== His whole career was marked by innovation. He was the first to use a computer [[LEO computer|LEO]], the first UK computer dedicated to business use) to analyse market research data (1959) and the first to do so in a readership survey (for the Western Mail in 1961). He carried out the first national study of public attitudes towards advertising (1954), the first survey of the poster audience (1948), the first readership survey among retailers (1948), the first national readership survey among children(1950), and the first qualitative study of regional newspaper readership (1963). In 1956, he acted as technical consultant to the first Italian national readership survey.
Not surprisingly, he has been much in demand by industry and academic bodies. He was at various times (and sometimes simultaneously) Visiting Professor of Marketing at the University of Bradford and the [[Cranfield School of Management|Cranfield Institute of Technology]] (now University), and Professor of Marketing and Media Policy at the International Management Centres. He was for twelve years Chairman of the Marketing Communication Research Centre, an ongoing operation funded by a number of major marketing companies which was founded in Bradford in 1972, and subsequently moved to Cranfield when he did. He had chaired the technical sub-committee of the National Readership Survey, and the Research Committees of the Regional Newspaper Advertising Bureau and of British Posters, and was for forty years Chairman of the Research Committee of the Advertising Association. He was a Governor of the [http://www.hatads.org.uk History of Advertising Trust], and a member of the editorial boards of the Journal of Advertising History and the International Journal of Advertising.
==Publications== As a by-product of his business and academic activities, and in various managerial capacities, he wrote and lectured extensively, in a number of countries, on management, marketing, research and related topics. Books published in earlier years, include ''Patterns of British Life'' (1948) and ''The Rural Market'' (1950).
His first book, written when he was 21 years old, ''The Insurance Man and his Trade'' (1938), in the 'Fact' library published monthly by Raymond Postgate (1/- cloth board, 6d. paper covers), suggested that burial insurance was 'the grossest form of systematic exploitation ever practised in this country'
A selection of his papers up to 1971 having been published in that year under the title of ''Perspectives in Management, Marketing and Research''.
Later publications included ''Behind the Headlines: Readings in the Economics of the Press'' (1978) and ''The Dynamics of the British Press, 1961 to 1984'' (1986) and he edited the massive Proceedings of the four International Readership Research Symposia of 1981, 1983, 1985 and 1988 (published as ''Readership Research: Theory and Practice'').
==External links== * [http://www.lse.ac.uk link London School Of Economics] * [http://www.admapmagazine.com link Admap] * [https://www.theguardian.com/media/2008/dec/05/obituary-harry-henry-yellow-pages Guardian obituary] * [http://www.campaignlive.co.uk/news/864929/Market-research-pioneer-Harry-Henry-dies/?DCMP=ILC-SEARCH Campaign obituary] * [http://www.research-live.com/news/research-pioneer-harry-henry-dies-aged-92/3005525.article Research Magazine obituary]
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Henry, Harry}} [[Category:1916 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]] [[Category:Researchers]] [[Category:Marketing people]]

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2012}} {{Coord|32|3|42.30|N|34|46|13.72|E|type:landmark_region:IS|display=title}} {{Infobox company | name = Israel Discount Bank Ltd. | logo = DiscountBank.svg | image = [[File:Israel Discount Bank central mangement building.JPG|250px]] | image_caption = Bank Discount head office in Tel Aviv | type = [[Public company|Public]] | traded_as = {{TASE|DSCT}} | foundation = [[Tel Aviv]], [[Mandatory Palestine]]
{{start date and age|1935}} | location_city = [[Bank Discount Tower]], [[Tel Aviv]] | location_country = [[Israel]] | key_people = Joseph Bachar
(Chairman)
Lilach Asher- Topilsky
(President and [[Chief Executive Officer|CEO]]) | industry = [[Banking]]
[[Financial services]] | products = [[Credit card]]s, [[Retail banking|consumer banking]], [[Commercial bank|corporate banking]], [[Financial services|finance and insurance]], [[investment banking]], [[mortgage loan]]s, [[private banking]], [[private equity]], [[savings]], [[Securities]], [[asset management]], [[wealth management]] | divisions = | revenue = {{profit}}[[US$]]2.4 Billion (2016) | operating_income = | net_income = {{profit}}[[US$]] 236 million (2016) | num_employees = 5,705 (2008) | subsid = [[Mercantile Discount Bank]]
Discount Mortgage Bank
Israel Discount Bank of New York (IDB Bank) | homepage = {{url|http://www.discountbank.co.il}} }} '''Israel Discount Bank Ltd.''' ({{lang-he|בנק דיסקונט לישראל בע"מ}}) is one of [[Israel]]'s three largest banks, with 260 branches, around 5,700 staff, and assets of [[Israeli new shekel|₪]]185 billion (US$48 billion).{{Citation |title = Dun's 100 Israel's Largest Enterprises 2011 – Commercial Banks – by Total Assets |url = http://duns100.dundb.co.il/ts.cgi?tsscript=/2011e/e30a4 |year = 2012 |journal = Dun & Bradstreet Israel |accessdate = 6 June 2012 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120714200136/http://duns100.dundb.co.il/ts.cgi?tsscript=%2F2011e%2Fe30a4 |archivedate = 14 July 2012 |df = dmy-all }}{{Cite news|url=http://banks-israel.com/discount-bank/|title=Discount Bank - Banks in Israel|newspaper=Banks in Israel|language=en-US|access-date=2016-11-19}} ==History== [[Image:Idb-nyc.jpg|thumb|250px|IDB Bank on Fifth Avenue in New York City]] {{Multiple image |align=right |direction=vertical |width=150 |image1=IsraelDiscountBank.jpg |alt1=Current logo (Hebrew) |caption1=Current logo (Hebrew) |image2=Israel Discount Bank Ltd. logo (Hebrew).png |alt2=previous logo |caption2=previous logo}} Israel Discount Bank, formerly known as ''Eretz Yisrael Discount Bank'' or ''Palestine Discount Bank'', was founded on 5 April 1935 by [[Leon Yehuda Recanati|Leon Recanati]], a new immigrant from [[Greece]] who had been the head of the [[Jewish]] community of [[Salonica]].{{cite book|title=International Directory of Company Histories: Volume 97|year=2008|publisher=[[St. James Press]]|isbn=9781558626188|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jKsSAQAAIAAJ|editor=Pederson, Jay P.|accessdate=20 May 2012|quote=In 1935, therefore, Recanati decided to create his own bank, called Palestine Discount Bank.}}{{cite web|title=Salonika|url=http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/judaica/ejud_0002_0017_0_17360.html|work=[[Encyclopaedia Judaica]]|publisher=[[Jewish Virtual Library]]|accessdate=20 May 2012|quote=Among the notable families from Salonika were the Florentin, *Recanati, Molcho, and Uzziel families. Leon Recanati founded the Israel Discount Bank, which later developed into one of the most important banks in the country, and the Florentin quarter of Tel Aviv is a manifestation of the initiative of immigrants from Salonika.}} His partners were Moshe Carasso and Yosef Albo.{{cite news|last=Horesh|first=Hadar|script-title=he:יואל קרסו: 'אני מרגיש את הזנב שלי עולה באש; אני חייב לרוץ, אני צריך להוכיח את עצמי'|url=http://www.themarker.com/career/1.455780|accessdate=20 May 2012|newspaper=[[TheMarker]]|date=7 September 2007|language=Hebrew|trans-title=Yoel Carasso: 'I feel my tail on fire; I've got to run, I have to prove myself'|quote=ראש המשפחה, ליאון רקנאטי, הקים בשותפות עם משה קרסו את בנק דיסקונט באמצע שנות ה-30.}}{{cite encyclopedia|editor-first=David|editor-last=Tidhar|editor-link=|encyclopedia=[[Encyclopedia of the Founders and Builders of Israel]]|title=הנרי (חיים) בורלא|trans-title=|url=http://www.tidhar.tourolib.org/tidhar/view/3/1354|accessdate=15 March 2013|language=Hebrew|year=1949|publisher=|volume=3|location=[[Israel]]|isbn=|page=1354|quote=ב-1935 בא לבקר בארץ, ובאותו הזמן נוסד בנק א"י לדיסקונט בע"מ על ידי מר ליאון ריקנטי (ראה כרך א', עמוד 174), יוסף אלבו ומשה קרסו.}}{{cite news|last=Lori|first=Aviva|title=Sour Grapes|url=http://www.haaretz.com/sour-grapes-1.132194|accessdate=23 May 2012|newspaper=[[Haaretz]]|date=20 August 2004}} The bank operated in a store at 39 [[Yehuda Halevi]] St. in [[Tel Aviv]]. It was founded with a focus on foreign trade and with a deliberate [[Sephardi Jews|Sephardic]] orientation so as to fill what Recanati perceived as a Sephardic void in the banking industry.{{cite web|last=Shmoul|first=Avi|title=Leon Recanati|url=http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/biography/Leon_Recanati.html|work=Lifestyles Magazine|publisher=[[Jewish Virtual Library]]|accessdate=20 May 2012|quote=The elder Leon, who was a teacher by profession, soon discovered that there were 70 banks in the country, but not one of them was run by Sephardim (Jews of Spanish or Middle Eastern descent). For this reason, he founded the Palestine Discount Bank in 1935, with a Sephardic orientation and an emphasis on foreign trade.}} Discount was unique in that it was open to private customers, whereas most other banks in Palestine at the time catered to merchants and institutions.{{cite news|last=Kramer|first=Stephen|title=Modern Caesarea|url=http://www.jewishtimes-sj.com/news/2008-12-12/columns/009.html|accessdate=26 May 2012|newspaper=Jewish Times of South Jersey|date=12 December 2008|quote=The bank was unique in that it was open to private customers, unlike the other few dozen banks operating in Palestine at that time, which mostly catered to business people and companies.|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518082500/http://www.jewishtimes-sj.com/news/2008-12-12/columns/009.html|archivedate=18 May 2015|df=dmy-all}} Shortly after the establishment of the State of Israel in 1948, Ottoman Bank, one of five large foreign banks active at the time, was merged into Discount Bank.{{cite news|last=Lavi|first=Zvi|title=Arabic names included in appendix of Holocaust victims’ deposits report|url=http://www.globes.co.il/serveen/globes/docview.asp?did=875693|accessdate=23 May 2012|newspaper=[[Globes]]|date=19 January 2005}}{{cite web|title=Note on Currency and Banking in Palestine and Transjordan|url=https://unispal.un.org/UNISPAL.NSF/0/1280A68C84F565B5852573A7004FF70B|publisher=[[United Nations]]|accessdate=23 May 2012|date=18 July 1949|quote=Lastly, the five big foreign banks are the Anglo-Palestine Bank; Barclay's Bank; the Ottoman Bank; the Holland Bank Union and the (Polish) Polska Kasa Opieki Bank.|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130910043410/http://unispal.un.org/UNISPAL.NSF/0/1280A68C84F565B5852573A7004FF70B|archive-date=10 September 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Discount became Israel's second largest bank in 1952, with over 40 branches throughout the country.{{cite web|script-title=he:אודות חייו של הארי רקנאטי, מייסד מוזיאוני ראלי לאומניות|trans-title=On the life of Harry Recanati, founder of the Ralli art museums|url=http://www.rallimuseums.com/285|publisher=rallimuseums.com|accessdate=23 May 2012|language=Hebrew|quote=ניהול הבנק בראשותו של הארי זכה להצלחה, ולקראת שנת 1952 הפך לבנק השני בגודלו בארץ.|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120918160555/http://www.rallimuseums.com/285|archivedate=18 September 2012|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|last=Aisenberg|first=Lydia|title=The Ralli Museum of Modern Art offers visitors an artistic treat without the constraints of a traditional gallery|url=http://www.jpost.com/Features//Article.aspx?id=55458|accessdate=26 May 2012|newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]|date=21 March 2007|quote=Renamed the Israel Discount Bank Ltd., the bank was Israel's second largest by the end of 1952, with over 40 branches throughout the country.}} It retained that position until the merger of [[Bank Hapoalim]] with the credit and saving funds of the [[Histadrut]] in 1957.{{cite journal|last=Galor|first=Zvi|title=Credit Co-ops and Co-operative Banks – the Israeli Case Study|journal=Co-op Dialogue|date=June 1998|volume=8|issue=1|pages=31–39|url=http://www.uwcc.wisc.edu/icic/orgs/ica/struc/Regional-Offices1/Regional-Office-for-Asia-and-Pacific1/Asia--Co-op-Dialogue--Vol--8--No--1--19981/dlg10.html|accessdate=23 May 2012|publisher=[[International Co-operative Alliance]]|quote=During the fifties a process started of mergers and amalgamations of these funds into Bank Hapoalim, a process which was accomplished by 1957.}}{{cite book|last=Greenberg|first=Yitzhak|script-title=he:בין עולים לוותיקים: ישראל בעלייה הגדולה, 1948–1953|trans-title=Israel in the Great Wave of Immigration: 1948–1953|year=1996|publisher=Yad Izhak Ben-Zvi|location=[[Jerusalem]]|isbn=965-217-131-X|url=http://www.kotar.co.il/KotarApp/Viewer.aspx?nBookID=87789047|editor=Ofer, Daliah|accessdate=23 May 2012|page=221|language=Hebrew|chapter=הרפורמות בחברת העובדים בעקבות העלייה הגדולה|quote=הפתרון שאומץ היה מיזוג בין הבנק לבין הקופות, בשנת 1957. האיחוד תרם לחישולו של בנק הפועלים כמכשיר הפיננסי של ההסתדרות, ולביסוסו כמנוף לפיתוח משק העובדים. הוא גם ביסס את מעמדו של הבנק במשק הישראלי בכלל ובמערכת הפיננסית בישראל בפרט, ובעקבותיו השיג בנק הפועלים את בנק דיסקונט ותפס את המקום השני אחרי בנק לאומי.}} Discount opened its first commercial bank in the United States in 1962 in the form of Israel Discount Bank of New York, or IDB Bank.{{cite news|last=Wrobel|first=Sharon|title=Discount seeks to buy small NYC bank to expand its US activity, chairman tells 'Post'|url=http://www.jpost.com/Business/BusinessNews/Article.aspx?id=151800|accessdate=26 May 2012|newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]|date=13 August 2009}} In 1965 Discount Bank was still described as a "bastion of the veteran Sephardic establishment."{{cite book|last=Elizur|first=Yuval|title=31 דמויות ממעצבי דור המדינה|trans-title=31 Shapers of the First Sixty Years of Israel|year=2008|publisher=Carmel|location=[[Jerusalem]]|isbn=978-965-407-869-6|url=http://www.kotar.co.il/KotarApp/Viewer.aspx?nBookID=66071760&nPageNum=133|editor=Sharett, Yaakov |editor2=Cohen, Yifaat|accessdate=23 May 2012|page=131|language=Hebrew|chapter=Chapter 6: Dan Tolkovsky|quote=המגע הישיר הבא בין טולקובסקי לביני היה בשנת 1965 לאחר מינויו למכ"ל החברה להשקעות של בנק דיסקונט. בנק דיסקונט היה באותם ימים מבצר הממסד הספרדי הוותיק.}} In 1952, the name of the bank was changed to Israel Discount Bank. Discount began establishing a presence in [[Florida]] in the late 1970s, at the time specializing in international banking. In 2002 it expanded its Florida-based operations to encompass domestic banking as well, after taking over part of the Hamilton Bank of Miami, which had been seized and closed by regulators.{{cite news|last=Freer|first=Jim|title=Israel Discount Bank picks up Hamilton's pieces|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/southflorida/stories/2002/02/18/story4.html?page=all|accessdate=26 May 2012|newspaper=[[South Florida Business Journal]]|date=18 February 2002}} ===Milestones=== * 1935 – bank founded in Tel Aviv. * 1949 – first public branch opens in Haifa; subsidiary established in U.S. * 1962 – first overseas branch opened at [[Fifth Avenue|511 5th Avenue]] in [[New York City]]. * 1963 – [[Initial public offering|IPO]] on [[Tel Aviv Stock Exchange]].{{cite news|title=Israel Discount Bank to Offer 300,000 Shares in the United States|url=http://archive.jta.org/article/1964/03/26/3076431/israel-discount-bank-to-offer-300000-shares-in-the-united-states|accessdate=28 May 2012|newspaper=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]|date=25 March 1964|quote=In April 1963, the Bank offered shares for the first time to the public in Israel and simultaneously placed a limited number of shares with private investors in the United States.}} * 1965 – 100th branch is opened. * 1972 – I.D.B. becomes first Israeli bank to install external [[Automated teller machine|ATM]]s. * 1983 – subsequent to the [[Bank stock crisis (Israel 1983)|bank stock crisis]], ownership is transferred to the [[Government of Israel]]. * 2006 – control of the bank is tendered to private hands, though the government continues to hold 31% of shares. The bank's new headquarters is at the [[Discount Bank Tower]] on [[Yehuda HaLevi Street]], [[Tel Aviv]].{{cite news|last1=WROBEL|first1=Sharon|title=ISRAEL DISCOUNT BANK NAMES YOSSI BACHAR ITS NEW CHAIRMAN|url=http://www.jpost.com/Business/Israel-Discount-Bank-names-Yossi-Bachar-its-new-chairman|accessdate=23 December 2017|publisher=Jerusalem Post|date=January 4, 2010}} * 12 January 2010 – government sells an additional 5% of the 25% bank's stock it owned at the time. * January 2014 Moody's rating remains A1 Positive ==Major holdings== Major Holdings of the bank include Mercantile Discount Bank, [[Israel Discount Bank of New York]], shares in [[First International Bank of Israel]], the Israel Discount Mortgage Bank, and Israel Credit Cards–Cal. ===Mercantile Discount Bank=== Mercantile Discount Bank has its roots in the [[Anglo-Egyptian Bank]], founded in 1864. Anglo-Egyptian operated four branches in [[Mandatory Palestine]] – in Jerusalem, Jaffa, Haifa, and Gaza. In 1925 Anglo-Egyptian was merged, along with Colonial Bank and the National Bank of South Africa, into Barclays Bank (Dominion, Colonial and Overseas). A subsidiary, jointly and equally owned by Barclays and Israel Discount Bank, was established in 1971–1972 and named Barclays Discount Bank. Israel Discount acquired full ownership of Barclays Discount in 1993 and renamed it Mercantile Discount Bank.{{cite book|title=Handbook on the History of European Banks|year=1994|publisher=[[Edward Elgar Publishing]]|location=[[Aldershot]]|isbn=1-85278-919-0|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=eXvfNDHpfWwC&pg=PA1198&lpg=PA1198|accessdate=28 May 2012|page=1198|chapter=Part 18: United Kingdom}}{{cite book|last=Keltie|first=John Scott|title=The Statesman's Year-Book|year=1921|publisher=[[Macmillan Publishers]]|location=[[London]]|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Page:Statesman%27s_Year-Book_1921.djvu/1408|authorlink=John Scott Keltie|accessdate=28 May 2012|page=1356|quote=The most important bank in Palestine is the Anglo-Egyptian Bank with branches at Jerusalem, Jaffa, Haifa, and Gaza.}}{{cite book|title=Barclays: The Business of Banking 1690–1996|year=2002|publisher=[[Cambridge University Press]]|location=[[Cambridge]]|isbn=0-521-79035-2|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=yAwipk34KP0C&pg=PA288|author=Ackrill, Margaret|author2=Hannah, Leslie|accessdate=28 May 2012|page=288|chapter=Chapter 6: Barclays abroad: the transition to global banking (1945–1992)|quote=However, in 1972 50% of the barely profitable business was sold to a new subsidiary, jointly owned, 50-50, with Discount Bank, Israel's second largest bank, and Discount eventually bought all of Barclays' share.}}{{cite news|last=Ben Gedalyahu|first=Tzvi|title=Barclays Joins Foreign Love Affair with Israel|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/146834#.T8NaCVIpR9M|accessdate=28 May 2012|newspaper=[[Arutz Sheva]]|date=16 August 2011}}{{cite news|last=Aizescu|first=Sivan|title=Barclays reestablishes commercial operations in Israel|url=http://www.haaretz.com/business/barclays-reestablishes-commercial-operations-in-israel-1.378660|accessdate=28 May 2012|newspaper=[[Haaretz]]|date=15 August 2011}} ===Israel Discount Bank of New York=== Israel Discount Bank established a subsidiary in the U.S. in 1949. The first U.S. branch was opened on New York's Fifth Avenue in 1962 in a ceremony attended by [[Eleanor Roosevelt]] and New York City Mayor [[Robert F. Wagner, Jr.|Robert Wagner]].{{cite news|title=Israeli Bank Opens U.S. Branch|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=4 April 1962}}{{cite web|title=IDB Bankholding Corporation Limited|url=http://www.library.hbs.edu/hc/lehman/chrono.html?company=idb_bankholding_corporation_limited|work=[[Harvard Business School]]|publisher=Lehman Brothers Collection: Contemporary Business Archives|accessdate=26 May 2012|year=1972|quote=In 1962, to much press coverage, including a ribbon cutting ceremony led by Eleanor Roosevelt and New York Mayor Wagner, the bank opened a branch in New York City.}} Eleanor Roosevelt opened the first account in the bank.{{cite news|title=Israel Bank Opens Branch in New York; Mrs. Roosevelt Opens First Account|url=http://cdn.jta.org/archive_pdfs/1962/1962-04-04_066.pdf|accessdate=26 May 2012|newspaper=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]|date=4 April 1962|page=4}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In 1967–1968 it acquired the Hias Immigrant Bank and changed its name to IDB Trust Company. It became the Israel Discount Bank of New York in 1979.{{cite news|title=Israel Discount Bank Buys Hias Immigrant Bank; Fiscal Statement Gives Details|url=http://archive.jta.org/article/1968/01/12/2944691/israel-discount-bank-buys-hias-immigrant-bank-fiscal-statement-gives-details|accessdate=26 May 2012|newspaper=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]|date=12 January 1968}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dfs.ny.gov/about/histi.txt|title=An Institutional History of Banks Operating in New York State – I|publisher=[[New York State Department of Financial Services]]|accessdate=26 May 2012|date=15 May 2012|quote=11/02/1967 Name Change To IDB Trust Company}} IDBNY has historically been tied to Jewish communities in Latin America, with funds from Chile, Brazil, Peru and Mexico accounting for 58% of the bank's deposits. It was ranked the 14th largest bank in New York in 2011 and was one of the few banks that did not suffer losses during the [[subprime mortgage crisis]].{{cite news|last=Peer|first=Eran|title=Discount Bank of New York sets sights on local market|url=http://www.globes.co.il/serveen/globes/docview.asp?did=1000664240|accessdate=26 May 2012|newspaper=[[Globes]]|date=14 July 2011}} ===Israel Credit Cards–Cal=== Israel Credit Cards–Cal (ICC–Cal, Visa–Cal, or simply Cal) is a credit card company in Israel that issues [[Visa Inc.|Visa]], [[MasterCard]] and [[Diners Club International|Diners]] credit cards. It was established in 1978 with [[Bank Leumi]] controlling 65% of the company and Discount Bank holding 35%.{{cite web|title=The credit card industry in Israel|url=http://www.ny.frb.org/research/conference/2005/antitrust/Spiegel.pdf|publisher=[[Federal Reserve Bank of New York]]|accessdate=27 May 2012|author=Gilo, David|author2=Spiegel, Yossi|page=1|date=September 2005|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080828034829/http://www.ny.frb.org/research/conference/2005/antitrust/Spiegel.pdf|archivedate=28 August 2008|df=dmy-all}} In 1998 the Antitrust Authority ordered Leumi and Discount to dissolve their partnership in order to increase competition.{{cite news|last=Koren|first=Ora|title=Tadmor to Leumi, Discount Banks: Dissolve Partnership in Visa by End ’99|url=http://www.globes.co.il/serveen/globes/docview.asp?did=371530|accessdate=27 May 2012|newspaper=[[Globes]]|date=8 July 1998}}{{cite news|last=Maltz|first=Judy|title=Application by Bank Leumi, Discount Bank, to Postpone Dissolution of Partnership in Visa ICC Rejected|url=http://www.globes.co.il/serveen/globes/docview.asp?did=378121|accessdate=27 May 2012|newspaper=[[Globes]]|date=13 September 1999}} Leumi subsequently sold its stake to Discount, which in turn sold 24% to businessman Eliezer Fishman, 20% to [[First International Bank of Israel]], and 5% to [[Harel Group|Harel Insurance Investments]].{{cite news|last=Dafna|first=Zucker|title=Discount Bank selling part of ICC-Cal to Azrieli|url=http://www.globes.co.il/serveen/globes/docview.asp?did=832677|accessdate=27 May 2012|newspaper=[[Globes]]|date=31 August 2004}} By mid-2007 Discount had regained a controlling interest of 71.8% in the company.{{cite news|last=Aflalo|first=Eti|script-title=he:דיסקונט והבינלאומי ישלמו לפישמן ולהראל עוד 35 מ' ש' בתמורה לאחזקות כאל|url=http://www.haaretz.co.il/misc/1.1395329|accessdate=27 May 2012|newspaper=[[Haaretz]]|date=18 March 2007|language=Hebrew|trans-title=Discount and First International will pay Fishman and Harel an additional NIS35m for Cal holdings|quote=בנק דיסקונט מחזיק כיום ב-71.8% מכאל, לאחר שרכש בתחילת החודש חלק מאחזקותיה של הראל השקעות בוויזה כאל תמורת 49 מיליון ולאחר שבקיץ 2006 רכש הבנק כ-17% ממניות ויזה כאל מקבוצת פישמן.}} A Nielsen Report published in 2007 indicated that Cal ranked 82nd in credit card issuing in the world in 2005.{{cite news|last=Peer|first=Eran|title=Bank Hapoalim 63rd in world credit card issuer ranking|url=http://www.globes.co.il/serveen/globes/docview.asp?did=1000180715|accessdate=27 May 2012|newspaper=[[Globes]]|date=7 February 2007}} ==Management== The bank's president is Lilach Asher- Topilsky.{{cite web|title=Group Overview: Senior Management|url=http://www.discountbank.co.il/wps/portal/corporate/!ut/p/c1/04_SB8K8xLLM9MSSzPy8xBz9CP0os3gjAwMTAwMjd7MQV0tDA09nSw93_9BgQwsjY6B8JJK8qaW_i4GnY4CTsbevu7GBuSFJul0MLYDy3pZu3oZelgbBbuYk6Q7xDbYw8AwM8fYy83YzdvcwJaA7HORX_G5HkcfiOpC8AQ7gaICmH9N9fh75uan6BbmhoREGmZ66joqKAGqQYQY!/dl2/d1/L0lDU0lKSWdrbUEhIS9JRFJBQUlpQ2dBek15cXchL1lCSkoxTkExTkk1MC01RncvN18yMDA0MDAyRzZURTkxMElDOUhHT1VTMThPNC9Tb19fXzMz/?WCM_PORTLET=PC_7_2004002G6TE910IC9HGOUS18O4_WCM&WCM_GLOBAL_CONTEXT=/wps/wcm/connect/corporate_content/DiscountCorpSite/Group_Overview/Senior_Management/Tabs/Senior+Management/|publisher=Israel Discount Bank|accessdate=20 May 2012}} Joseph Bachar is the chairman of the [[board of directors]].{{cite web|title=Group Overview: Board of Directors|url=http://www.discountbank.co.il/wps/portal/corporate/!ut/p/c1/04_SB8K8xLLM9MSSzPy8xBz9CP0os3gjAwMTAwMjd7MQV0tDA09nSw93_9BgQwsjE6B8JJK8qaW_i4GnY4CTsbevu7GBuSFJul0MLYDy3pZu3oZelgbBbuYk6Q7xDbYw8AwM8fYy83YzdvcwJaA7HORX_G5HkcfiOpC8AQ7gaICmH9N9fh75uan6BbmhoREGmZ66joqKACVn-qM!/dl2/d1/L0lDU0lKSWdrbUEhIS9JRFJBQUlpQ2dBek15cXchL1lCSkoxTkExTkk1MC01RncvN18yMDA0MDAyRzZURTkxMElDOUhHT1VTMThPNC8wa19fXzIx/?WCM_PORTLET=PC_7_2004002G6TE910IC9HGOUS18O4_WCM&WCM_GLOBAL_CONTEXT=/wps/wcm/connect/corporate_content/DiscountCorpSite/Group_Overview/Board_Of_Directors/Tabs/Board+of+Directors/|publisher=Israel Discount Bank|accessdate=20 May 2012}} ==Herzl at Lilienblum Street(s) Museum== To receive a permit for building the 30-story [[Bank Discount Tower]] to house the bank headquarters on [[Herzl Street]] in Tel Aviv, Bank Discount undertook the historical restoration of the Schiff House, built in 1910. The building reopened as the Museum of Banking and Tel Aviv Nostalgia, featuring interactive exhibits and old movie clips.[http://www.jpost.com/LocalIsrael/TelAvivAndCenter/Article.aspx?id=178053 Feel the heartbeat of Old Tel Aviv, [[Jerusalem Post]]] ==See also== *[[Banking in Israel]] *[[Economy of Israel]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commonscat|Israel Discount Bank}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20050901080012/http://www.discount-bank.co.il/cgi-bin/inetcgi/discount/front/eng_homepage.jsp Israel Discount Bank Ltd. official homepage] *[http://www.idbbank.com Israel Discount Bank of New York official homepage] {{TA 25 companies}} {{Israeli banks}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Israel Discount Bank}} [[Category:Banks established in 1935]] [[Category:Banks of Israel|Dis]] [[Category:Companies listed on TASE]] [[Category:Financial services companies of Israel]] [[Category:Israeli brands]] [[Category:Finance in Israel]] [[Category:1935 establishments in Mandatory Palestine]] [[Category:Recanati family]] [[Category:Companies based in Tel Aviv]]

{{more footnotes|date=November 2013}}
'''Joseph Alphonse Marie Colruyt''' (2 August 1928, [[Uccle]] - 6 October 1994, [[Puget-Théniers]])<ref>[http://www.mandlonline.com/IMG/pdf/archives_mm_ef_entreprise.pdf Short biography]</ref> was a Belgian business owner. He was the son of [[Franz Colruyt]], founder of the [[Colruyt]] company. Under his leadership, the company began the Colruyt retail chain known for its "lowest price" strategy.
== Career ==
When Colruyt took over the company from his father Franz in 1958, the company was a dry food wholesaler. As it became more expensive to deliver small-volume orders to smaller stores, he opened the first ''Cash & Carry'' (briefly called 'Cash') in Hall in 1964: a self-service formula for independent shop keepers.
In the mid-1960s, Jo Colruyt chose to switch to retail and took over the self-service business Verloo in [[Elsene]] and launched his lowest prices policy, offering famous brands 10% cheaper.
This was when the struggle for efficiency, simplicity and economy typical of Colruyt stores began. At the time, the company was nearly broke. In 1976 all stores took the name Colruyt.
=== Less successful initiatives ===
At the end of the 1970s and into the early 1980s, Colruyt launched various businesses with varying success. Examples include an auto rental agency, selling wooden homes of Finlandia Hus, 'Auto Frit' mobile chip stalls and 'Green Pepper' self-service restaurants. These businesses were suspended in the mid-1980s.
=== Turnabout after crisis situation ===
In the mid-1980s the Colruyt company was almost bankrupt, competing with newcomer [[Aldi]]. From 1988 the company slowly returned to profitability. Activities included the continuation of low prices on about 300 products. In 1987 the company replaced the [[punched card]] with price labels and 'full scanning' at the cash register. Replenishment, stock management and orders were automated with [[bar code]] scanners.<ref>{{cite web|last=Colruyt India|title=History|url=http://www.colruyt.in/colruytindia/static/colruytAboutColruytReadMore.htm|accessdate=29 December 2013}}</ref>
=== Management ===
Colruyt introduced a horizontal corporate structure with as few managers as possible. He paid attention to employee participation and viewed training in personnel as important.<ref name=":0">{{cite news|url=http://www.standaard.be/artikel/detail.aspx?artikelid=DST24121999_051|title=Biznews Jo Colruyt|date=23 December 1999|work=[[De Standaard]]|accessdate=2013-09-30}}</ref>
== Death ==
After 35 years as the head of the company Jo Colruyt died in 1994. His son [[Jef Colruyt]] took over company management.
== Recognition ==
In 1992, Jo Colruyt was elected Manager of the Year by the magazine ''Trends''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.standaard.be/artikel/detail.aspx?artikelid=DST09012003_101|title=Honorary citizen of Beersel|date=16 July 2012|work=[[De Standaard]]|accessdate=2013-06-01}}</ref>
== References ==

{{good article}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox video game | title = Jurassic World Evolution | image = Jurassic World Evolution cover art.jpg | developer = [[Frontier Developments]] | publisher = Frontier Developments | series = ''[[List of Jurassic Park video games|Jurassic Park]]'' | director = Michael Brookes | producer = Craig Abraham | designer = Andrew Fletcher | artist = John Laws | writer = John Zuur Platten | composer = Jeremiah Pena | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]]
[[PlayStation 4]]
[[Xbox One]] | released = 12 June 2018 | genre = [[Business simulation game|Business simulation]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Jurassic World Evolution''''' is a [[Business simulation game|business simulation]] [[video game]] developed and published by [[Frontier Developments]]. Based on the 2015 film ''[[Jurassic World]]'', the game was released on 12 June 2018, for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One]]. In the game, players construct a dinosaur park on Las Cinco Muertes [[Archipelago]], a group of five islands also known as the "Five Deaths". The game features more than 40 types of dinosaurs; their [[gene]]s can be modified to introduce new features. Players are given contracts to fulfill by three divisions, Science, Security and Entertainment, allowing them to progress. A sandbox mode set on [[Isla Nublar]], the setting of the film, can be unlocked. The game was created by a development team of approximately 100 people with a budget of around £8 million. Its development began in 2016, after [[NBCUniversal]] approached Frontier Developments about creating a game to accompany the theatrical release of ''[[Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom]]''. To do this, Frontier staff inspected different dinosaur models and reference materials sent by Universal, watched the ''Jurassic Park'' films, read the novels and fan theories. The team consulted paleontologist [[Jack Horner (paleontologist)|Jack Horner]] when they designed the dinosaurs. [[Jeff Goldblum]], [[Bryce Dallas Howard]] and [[B. D. Wong]] reprised their roles from the ''[[Jurassic Park]]'' film series, voicing remarks to players and contributing to the game's narrative. Announced at [[Gamescom 2017]], the game received a generally mixed critical reception. Critics praised its dinosaur designs and graphics, but the game's contracts, simulation and management gameplay were less well-received. The game's tutorial and learning curve were also criticized. Five weeks after its initial release, the game had sold one million copies through digital and physical sales. The game was supported with free updates and [[downloadable content]] upon release. ==Gameplay== [[File:Jurassic World Evolution gameplay screenshot.jpg|thumb|left|A gameplay screenshot featuring the hybrid dinosaur ''[[Indominus rex]]'' from ''[[Jurassic World]]''. To keep dinosaurs happy, players must fulfill different requirements as indicated by the status bar shown at the left.]] ''Jurassic World Evolution'' is a [[business simulation game]] that allows the player to construct a Jurassic World dinosaur theme park with attractions and research facilities. Players must build an Expedition Center, which sends paleontologists to fossil dig sites to obtain dinosaurs' DNA material. [[DNA sequencing]] unlocks new dinosaurs and updates their statistics, such as lifespan and resilience. With enough DNA content, players can use the Hammond Research Center to breed and incubate dinosaurs. Players can also improve the dinosaurs' genes by integrating DNA from modern species with that of the dinosaurs to fill their gaps and allow them to evolve. Modifications to the dinosaurs' DNA change their base statistics, as well as everything from their level of aggressiveness to their appearance.{{cite web|url=https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-03-29-jurassic-world-evolution-finds-a-way-to-be-refreshingly-different|title=Jurassic World Evolution finds a way to be refreshingly different|first=Johnny|last=Chiodini|work=[[Eurogamer]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181024054143/https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-03-29-jurassic-world-evolution-finds-a-way-to-be-refreshingly-different|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The game features a terrain tool which allows players to modify the environment by planting trees and creating water sources. Dinosaurs are the game's main attraction and income earner. The game features approximately 40 dinosaur species at launch.{{cite web|last=Jones|first=Ali|title=Jurassic World Evolution has 40 dinosaur species, including Indominus Rex|url=https://www.pcgamesn.com/jurassic-world-evolution/jurassic-world-evolution-dinosaurs|website=[[PCGamesN]]|accessdate=1 April 2018|date=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180614191615/https://www.pcgamesn.com/jurassic-world-evolution/jurassic-world-evolution-dinosaurs|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Players can name each dinosaur after they are incubated.{{cite web|url=https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-06-14-jurassic-world-evolution-review-a-beautiful-overly-brutal-park-sim|title=Jurassic World Evolution review - a beautiful, overly brutal park sim|first=Vikki|last=Blake|work=[[Eurogamer]]|date=14 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916093022/https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-06-14-jurassic-world-evolution-review-a-beautiful-overly-brutal-park-sim|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Players need to build enclosures to contain dinosaurs for visitors' viewing. The needs of different dinosaurs, like the type of food they eat and the extent of the social interactions they require, must be met to keep them healthy and satisfied.{{cite web|url=https://www.gamesradar.com/jurassic-world-evolution-build-your-own-park-farm-custom-dinosaurs-pull-out-the-tranq-gun-when-it-all-goes-wrong/|title=Jurassic World Evolution: Build your own park, farm custom dinosaurs, pull out the tranq gun when it all goes wrong|first=David|last=Houghton |date=2 April 2018|accessdate=2 April 2018|work=[[GamesRadar]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612140830/https://www.gamesradar.com/jurassic-world-evolution-build-your-own-park-farm-custom-dinosaurs-pull-out-the-tranq-gun-when-it-all-goes-wrong/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Dinosaurs, controlled by [[artificial intelligence]], will interact with each other and the environment. For instance, carnivores will attack carnivores of a different species, and they will hunt down herbivores. Players also need to construct various entertainment rides, as well as amenities like restaurants and shops to please the guests. An example of tourist attractions is the Gyrosphere or the monorail from ''Jurassic World''.{{cite web|url=https://www.redbull.com/gb-en/jurassic-world-evolution-guide|title=How to build your own dinosaur park in Jurassic World Evolution|first=Ian|last=Dransfield|work=[[Red Bull]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612140202/https://www.redbull.com/gb-en/jurassic-world-evolution-guide|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Players can also use the game's photo mode to take pictures of dinosaurs, which help the park to earn money and publicity.{{cite web|url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-is-a-chaotic-sandbox-for-/1100-6457769/|title=Jurassic World Evolution Is A Chaotic Sandbox For Dinosaur Management Mayhem|first=Michael|last=Rougeau|work=[[GameSpot]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612143710/https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-is-a-chaotic-sandbox-for-/1100-6457769/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Each entertainment facility and amenity comes with its own management system. Players are able to set and adjust entry fees as well as the number of staff present in each facility. Dinosaurs can be sold to earn additional income.{{cite web|url=https://www.usgamer.net/articles/06-07-2018-jurassic-world-evolution-guide-beginners-tips-and-tricks-create-dinosaurs-divisions/jurassic-world-evolution-sell-dinosaurs|title=How to Sell Dinosaurs in Jurassic World Evolution|first=Jake|last=Green|work=[[USgamer]]|date=7 June 2018|accessdate=8 July 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180708133353/https://www.usgamer.net/articles/06-07-2018-jurassic-world-evolution-guide-beginners-tips-and-tricks-create-dinosaurs-divisions/jurassic-world-evolution-sell-dinosaurs|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Various emergency situations may happen in the park, including power failures, unpredictable weather, and dinosaur breakouts, which must be addressed by players to ensure guests' safety and happiness. Players can build an ACU Center and a Ranger Station, which are responsible for maintaining the park's security. They can sedate escaped dinosaurs, medicate sick dinosaurs, resupply dinosaur feeders, transport dinosaurs, fix fences, and more. Players can also control vehicles from a [[third-person perspective]] such as helicopters and [[4x4]] trucks to complete these tasks. Emergency shelters to protect the guests, as well as other security structures like power network redundancies and storm warning centers, can be built. Many of these security facilities can be upgraded to strengthen their efficiency when dealing with emergencies. ===Gameplay modes=== In the career mode, the player's goal is to develop five-star parks across the fictional islands of the Las Cinco Muertes [[Archipelago]].{{cite web|last=McWhertor|first=Michael|title=Jurassic World park sim coming from Planet Coaster developer|url=https://www.polygon.com/2017/8/20/16176368/jurassic-world-evolution-sim-frontier-developments-ps4-xbox-one-pc|website=[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]|accessdate=22 August 2017|date=20 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181003123003/https://www.polygon.com/2017/8/20/16176368/jurassic-world-evolution-sim-frontier-developments-ps4-xbox-one-pc|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/03/29/jurassic-park-evolution-wants-to-show-you-the-best-dinosaurs-youve-ever-seen|title=Jurassic World Evolution Wants To Show You The Best Dinosaurs You've Ever Seen|first=Lucy|last=O'Brien|work=[[IGN]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612145754/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/03/29/jurassic-park-evolution-wants-to-show-you-the-best-dinosaurs-youve-ever-seen|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} [[Ian Malcolm (Jurassic Park character)|Dr. Ian Malcolm]] assists players throughout the game.{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2018/03/13/jeff-goldblum-returns-for-jurassic-world-evolution.aspx|title=Jeff Goldblum Returns For Jurassic World Evolution|first=Matthew|last=Kato|work=[[Game Informer]]|date=13 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612162330/https://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2018/03/13/jeff-goldblum-returns-for-jurassic-world-evolution.aspx|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Players will meet other key figures representing the three branches of the park's development: Entertainment, Security, and Science. Each of these characters tries to convince players to develop the park in accordance with their advice.{{cite web|url=https://mashable.com/2018/03/29/jurassic-world-evolution-game-hands-on/#cHqygDgUTZq6|title=Jurassic 'World Evolution' is the dino video game of our childhood dreams|first=Jess|last=Joho|work=[[Mashable]]|date=29 March 2018|accessdate=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180705233358/https://mashable.com/2018/03/29/jurassic-world-evolution-game-hands-on/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} They give players "contracts" to complete which include a series of goals and objectives. These contracts add narrative to the game, as well as provide rewards and reputation in their respective domains.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQAY5iLgUVo|title=Jurassic World Evolution - First Official Gameplay Demo|work=Frontier Developments|date=31 March 2018|accessdate=31 March 2018}} Players are advised to keep a close eye on their reputation within each division. If a player's reputation within a division gets too low, that creates a [[sabotage]] in the player's park that will need to be attended to immediately. For instance, the park's power could be shut down allowing dinosaurs to break out, or a disease could be introduced to infect them.{{cite web|url=https://www.polygon.com/2018/6/11/17446528/jurassic-world-evolution-employees-dennis-nedry|title=Your employees in Jurassic World Evolution can sabotage your facilities|first=Ryan|last=Gillian|work=[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=8 July 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181024060828/https://www.polygon.com/2018/6/11/17446528/jurassic-world-evolution-employees-dennis-nedry|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} These divisions all feed into the parks' ratings. The five islands, each with different characteristics and challenges, will gradually unlock with sufficient positive park ratings. [[Isla Nublar]] — the island featured in ''[[Jurassic Park (film)|Jurassic Park]]'', ''[[Jurassic World]]'', and ''[[Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom]]''{{cite web|last=Blain|first=Louise|title=Life finds a way. Jurassic World Evolution might just be the game that the movies deserve|url=http://www.gamesradar.com/life-finds-a-way-jurassic-world-evolution-might-just-be-the-game-that-the-movies-deserve/|website=[[GamesRadar]]|accessdate=22 August 2017|date=21 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612162513/https://www.gamesradar.com/life-finds-a-way-jurassic-world-evolution-might-just-be-the-game-that-the-movies-deserve/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} — is the setting for a [[Sandbox game|sandbox]] mode that is separate from the game's career mode. The sandbox mode is unlocked once a four-star park rating is achieved on Isla Matanceros, the starting island.{{cite web|url=https://www.gamerevolution.com/guides/395965-jurassic-world-evolution-sandbox-mode-how-to-get-unlimited-money|title=Jurassic World Evolution Sandbox Mode: How to Get Unlimited Money|first=Paul|last=Tamburro|work=[[Game Revolution]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916130418/https://www.gamerevolution.com/guides/395965-jurassic-world-evolution-sandbox-mode-how-to-get-unlimited-money|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Once this is accomplished, everything players have unlocked in career mode, such as building upgrades and dinosaurs, will transfer over to the sandbox; anything locked in career mode remains in the sandbox.{{cite news|last1=Krupa|first1=Daniel|last2=Murphy|first2=Gav|title=Jurassic World Evolution: Sandbox Mode Details|url=https://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/21/jurassic-world-evolution-sandbox-mode-details-ign-first|accessdate=25 May 2018|work=IGN|date=21 May 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612145923/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/21/jurassic-world-evolution-sandbox-mode-details-ign-first|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} In sandbox mode, players have unlimited funds, and they can set the weather and time of day at their parks. Challenge Mode, available in an update after the game's release, involves playing with adjustable levels of difficulty and limited money, in addition to other differences like fees and penalties against players. ==Development and release== [[File:Jurassic World Evolution at E3 2018.jpg|thumb|right|''Jurassic World Evolution'' stand at [[Electronic Entertainment Expo 2018|E3 2018]]]] ''Jurassic World Evolution'' was developed and published by [[Frontier Developments]], and is based on the 2015 film ''Jurassic World''.{{cite web|last=Pereira|first=Chris|title=Jurassic World Evolution Mixes Theme Park Sims With Jurassic Park|url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-mixes-theme-park-sims-wit/1100-6452667/|work=[[GameSpot]]|accessdate=23 February 2018|date=21 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612141759/https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-mixes-theme-park-sims-wit/1100-6452667/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} [[NBCUniversal]] had wanted a game to accompany the theatrical release of its 2018 film ''[[Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom]]'' and approached Frontier Developments about creating it two years or so before the film's eventual release. Frontier Developments was also interested in creating a dinosaur game.{{cite web |last=Takahashi |first=Dean |title=How Frontier leveled up movie games with Jurassic World Evolution |url=https://venturebeat.com/2018/06/20/how-frontier-leveled-up-movie-games-with-jurassic-world-evolution/ |work=[[VentureBeat]] |accessdate=20 June 2018 |page=1–2 |date=20 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180620231932/https://venturebeat.com/2018/06/20/how-frontier-leveled-up-movie-games-with-jurassic-world-evolution/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The game was created with a development team of approximately 100 people, on a budget of around [[£]]8 million.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/gaming/features/david-braben-interview-1202846009/|title='Jurassic World: Evolution,' 'Elite' Dev on State of Gaming|first=Arthur|last=Gies|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=14 June 2018|accessdate=30 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180703141716/https://variety.com/2018/gaming/features/david-braben-interview-1202846009/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}{{cite web|last=Hanson|first=Ben|title=Jurassic World Evolution's Developers Share New Details|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2018/04/01/jurassic-world-evolutions-developers-share-new-details.aspx|work=[[Game Informer]]|accessdate=1 April 2018|date=1 April 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612190851/https://www.gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2018/04/01/jurassic-world-evolutions-developers-share-new-details.aspx|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} It was built using Frontier Developments' Cobra [[game engine]].{{cite web |title=Players Can Now Build Their Own Jurassic World as Jurassic World Evolution Launches Today for PC, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One |url=https://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/319860/Players_Can_Now_Build_Their_Own_Jurassic_World_as_Jurassic_World_Evolution_Launches_Today_for_PC_PlayStation_4_and_Xbox_One.php |work=[[Gamasutra]]|accessdate=14 June 2018 |date=12 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180614172134/https://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/319860/Players_Can_Now_Build_Their_Own_Jurassic_World_as_Jurassic_World_Evolution_Launches_Today_for_PC_PlayStation_4_and_Xbox_One.php|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} [[Universal Pictures]] provided the developers with dinosaur models from [[Jurassic Park|the films]] to allow for a high level of detail, as well as reference materials and audio. To aid in creating the game, the development team closely watched the films and read [[Michael Crichton]]'s novels, ''[[Jurassic Park (novel)|Jurassic Park]]'' and ''[[The Lost World (Crichton novel)|The Lost World]]'', and fan theories. In addition, Universal and the team had discussions about various elements in the game.{{cite news|last=Keyes|first=Rob|title=Jurassic World Evolution: Creative Director Michael Brookes Interview |url=https://screenrant.com/jurassic-world-evolution-michael-brookes-interview/|accessdate=3 April 2018|work=Screen Rant|date=2 April 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612141838/https://screenrant.com/jurassic-world-evolution-michael-brookes-interview/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} History from each of the films was added to the game. For example, [[Jeff Goldblum]] reprised his role as Ian Malcolm from the first two ''Jurassic Park'' films. [[Bryce Dallas Howard]] and [[B. D. Wong]] also reprised their roles from ''Jurassic World''.{{cite news|last=Chapman|first=Tom|title=Bryce Dallas Howard and BD Wong Will Also Be in Jurassic World Evolution|url=https://screenrant.com/jurassic-world-evolution-bryce-dallas-howard-bd-wong/|accessdate=25 April 2018|work=Screen Rant|date=25 April 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180714130253/https://screenrant.com/jurassic-world-evolution-bryce-dallas-howard-bd-wong/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} ''[[Tyrannosaurus rex]]'' was one of the first dinosaurs the development team began working on. For the ''T. rex'' roars, the game's sound team obtained audio samples from the films and then altered them for originality. The animation team then altered their ''T. rex'' roaring animations to fit the sound effects. To design the dinosaurs the development team primarily referred to the films for consistency, while incorporating some of the latest scientific discoveries to add to their designs. The team also studied birds and other animals to aid in designing the dinosaurs. In addition to their designs, dinosaur behavior was based on a combination of the films and scientific findings.{{cite web|last=Krupa|first=Daniel|title=How Jurassic World Evolution Made Its T. Rex|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/16/how-jurassic-world-evolution-made-its-trex-ign-first|work=[[IGN]]|accessdate=17 May 2018|date=16 May 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180711023618/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/16/how-jurassic-world-evolution-made-its-trex-ign-first|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Paleontologist [[Jack Horner (paleontologist)|Jack Horner]], who served as an advisor on the films, was also consulted for advice on the game's dinosaurs.{{cite web |last=Freeman |first=Will |title=Jurassic World Evolution neatly splices together management games and dinosaurs |url=https://www.pcgamesn.com/jurassic-world-evolution/jurassic-world-evolution-dinosaurs-guide |work=[[PCGamesN]]|accessdate=20 June 2018 |date=4 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180620232040/https://www.pcgamesn.com/jurassic-world-evolution/jurassic-world-evolution-dinosaurs-guide|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} They were given bright and colorful hides based on new dinosaur research. In February 2017, Frontier's CEO [[David Braben]] announced the company was working on a new project based on an existing Hollywood property.{{cite web|url=https://www.pcgamesn.com/frontier-third-game-hollywood-movie|title=Frontier will adapt Hollywood movie with “high worldwide profile” for their third franchise|first=Richard|last=Scott-James|work=[[PCGamesN]]|date=6 February 2017|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916094936/https://www.pcgamesn.com/frontier-third-game-hollywood-movie|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} On 20 August 2017, the game was announced during [[Gamescom 2017]].{{cite news|last1=Sliva|first1=Marty|title=Gamescom 2017: Jurassic World Evolution Announced|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2017/08/20/gamescom-2017-jurassic-world-evolution-announced|accessdate=20 August 2017|work=IGN|date=20 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612162718/http://www.ign.com/articles/2017/08/20/gamescom-2017-jurassic-world-evolution-announced|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Later, on 7 October, footage showcasing the in-game engine was revealed during the first annual Frontier Expo.{{cite news|last1=Walker|first1=Alex|title=A First Look At Jurassic World Evolution|url=https://www.kotaku.com.au/2017/10/a-first-look-at-jurassic-world-evolution/|accessdate=9 October 2017|work=[[Kotaku]] Australia|date=9 October 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180623032759/https://www.kotaku.com.au/2017/10/a-first-look-at-jurassic-world-evolution/|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The game was digitally released for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One]] on 12 June 2018, coinciding with the theatrical release of ''Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom''. A free game update based on ''Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom'', with six dinosaurs from the film, was released on 22 June 2018.{{cite news|last=Krupa|first=Daniel|title=Maintaining Order in Jurassic World Evolution (Developer Diary)|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/18/maintaining-order-in-jurassic-world-evolution-developer-diary-a-ign-first|accessdate=25 May 2018|work=[[IGN]]|date=18 May 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612162721/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/05/18/maintaining-order-in-jurassic-world-evolution-developer-diary-a-ign-first|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}{{cite web |last=Cryer |first=Hirun |title=Jurassic World Evolution Gets Fallen Kingdom-Themed Update, New Dinos and Bug Fixes Included |url=https://www.usgamer.net/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-gets-fallen-kingdom-themed-update-new-dinos-and-bug-fixes-included |work=USgamer |accessdate=22 June 2018 |date=22 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180624064718/https://www.usgamer.net/articles/jurassic-world-evolution-gets-fallen-kingdom-themed-update-new-dinos-and-bug-fixes-included|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} Physical copies of the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One version were distributed by [[Sold-Out Software|Sold Out]] on 3 July 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2018-07-19-jurassic-world-evolution-hits-one-million-sales|title=Jurassic World Evolution hits one million sales|work=Gameindustry.biz|date=19 July 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916093353/https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2018-07-19-jurassic-world-evolution-hits-one-million-sales|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}{{cite web|last=O'Brien|first=Lucy|title=Jurassic World Evolution Gets Official Digital, Physical Release Date: Life finds a way on June 12 and July 3|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/03/29/jurassic-world-evolution-gets-official-digital-physical-release-date|website=IGN|accessdate=1 April 2018|date=29 March 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612165151/http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/03/29/jurassic-world-evolution-gets-official-digital-physical-release-date|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} In August 2018, Frontier Developments announced an upcoming [[Patch (computing)|patch]] that would alter the sizes of several dinosaurs to match their real-life and film counterparts.{{cite web |last=Capel |first=Chris |title=The Jurassic World Evolution Spinosaurus Will Soon Be Bigger Than The T-Rex |url=https://www.gamerevolution.com/news/419233-the-jurassic-world-evolution-spinosaurus-will-soon-be-bigger-than-the-t-rex |website=GameRevolution |accessdate=19 August 2018 |date=16 August 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180819214248/https://www.gamerevolution.com/news/419233-the-jurassic-world-evolution-spinosaurus-will-soon-be-bigger-than-the-t-rex|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The update was released in September 2018, and included additional sandbox and gameplay options, as well as the addition of Challenge Mode.{{cite web |last=Bankhurst |first=Adam |title=Jurassic World: Evolution Update Adds a Challenge Mode and Changes Dinosaur Sizes |url=https://www.ign.com/articles/2018/09/13/jurassic-world-evolution-update-adds-a-challenge-mode-and-changes-dinosaur-sizes |website=IGN |accessdate=14 September 2018 |date=13 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180914203806/https://www.ign.com/articles/2018/09/13/jurassic-world-evolution-update-adds-a-challenge-mode-and-changes-dinosaur-sizes|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}} The first paid [[downloadable content]] (DLC), ''Secrets of Dr. Wu'', was released on November 20, 2018. The DLC introduced new story missions, research options and new dinosaur and hybrid species. On the same day, Frontier introduced new AI behaviors and a day-night cycle into the game via a free update.{{cite web|url=https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-11-08-jurassic-world-evolution-gets-secrets-of-dr-wu-paid-dlc-later-this-month|title=Jurassic World Evolution gets Secrets of Dr. Wu paid DLC later this month |first=Matt|last=Wales|work=[[Eurogamer]]|date=November 8, 2018|accessdate=November 10, 2018}}{{cite web |last=Tarason |first=Dominic |title=Jurassic World Evolution mutates with a major update and its first paid DLC |url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2018/11/20/jurassic-world-evolution-update-and-dlc/ |website=Rock, Paper, Shotgun |accessdate=22 November 2018 |date=20 November 2018}} ==Reception== {{video game reviews | MC = (PC) 69/100{{cite web|url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/jurassic-world-evolution|title=Jurassic World Evolution for PC|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180616035903/http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/jurassic-world-evolution|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}
(PS4) 68/100{{cite web|url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-4/jurassic-world-evolution|title=Jurassic World Evolution for PS4|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180922160753/https://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-4/jurassic-world-evolution|archivedate=24 October 2018|deadurl=no}}
(XONE) 76/100{{cite web|url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-one/jurassic-world-evolution|title=Jurassic World Evolution for Xbox One|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724130952/http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-one/jurassic-world-evolution|archivedate=24 October = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web|url=https://www.gamerevolution.com/review/395445-jurassic-world-evolution-review-holy-fing-st-its-a-dinosaur|title=Jurassic World Evolution Review – Holy F***ing S**t, It’s a Dinosaur|first=Paul|last=Tamburro|work=[[Game Revolution]]|date=11 June 2018|accessdate=16 September 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181004214405/https://www.gamerevolution.com/review/395445-jurassic-world-evolution-review-holy-fing-st-its-a-dinosaur|archivedate=24 October
